content:
Irish myth: *Cross; Icelandic: *Boberg; India:
Thompson-Balys; Hindu: Keith 153.
child: Only one person can overtake hero.

content:
Only one thing will kill a certain man. *Dh
II 211; *Wesselski Archiv Orientální II 430; Penzer VIII 109 n. 3; R. M. Meyer
Archiv f. Religionsgeschichte (1907) 93ff. -- Irish: MacCulloch Celtic 151,
*Cross; Icelandic: De la Saussaye 154, 156, *Boberg; N. A. Indian: *Thompson
Tales 357 n. 287g; Africa (Cameroon): Ittman 77, (Swahili): Steere 441.
child:
Person can be killed only by red-hot spits being thrust
through soles of his feet.

Giant ogre can be killed only with iron club he carries
(with own sword).

content:
Invulnerability except in one spot. **DeCock Studien
153ff.--Irish myth: *Cross; Welsh: MacCulloch Celtic 97; Icelandic: *Boberg;
Norse: De la Saussaye 144, Von Sydow Fåvne 27ff.; French Canadian: Barbeau JAFL
XXIX 11; Greek: *Basset RTP XXV 124 n. 1, Frazer Apollodorus II 60 n. 2, 214 n.
1; Jewish: *Neuman; Hindu: Keith 125, Penzer I 127; Siberian: Holmberg Siberian
389; Eskimo (Mackenzie Area): Jenness 67; N. A. Indian: *Thompson Tales 345 n.
246; Africa: Werner African 236, (Fang): Trilles 202.
child: Spot below right ear only vulnerable one.
Leprosy cured by holy water except on thumb.
Man can be injured only in armpits.

content: Only one way to besiege certain city.

Ogre vulnerable only when his face is turned away when he
is struck.

Sword which will break in only one peril: this known only
to the maker of the sword.

Gaster FL II
57; Nutt Holy Grail 11.
Only one ferule fits certain staff.

Vessel from which nothing can be drunk save through certain
tube.
All trees except aspen refuse to make Christ’s cross.
Dh II 209; North Carolina: Brown Collection I 635.
Only one person refuses to weep at hero‘s death.
All snakes but one placated by music.

In snake den prisoner
fails to placate one snake and loses his life. Hdwb. d. Märchens I 437a.
